headline: T-Mobile Visa Card Partnership Could Be a Game Changer for Capital One Financial (COF)
summary: Earlier this month, T-Mobile and Capital One introduced the T-Mobile Visa credit card, offering rewards linked to T-Mobile purchases and seamless digital features, with applications available online and at retail locations from November 10, 2025. This collaboration expands Capital One's access to T-Mobile’s broad customer base, potentially increasing its fee and interest income through integrated credit offerings and innovative digital rewards. We’ll explore how the launch of the T-Mobile...

headline: TD Cowen Adjusts T-Mobile (TMUS) Price Target After Solid Q3 Performance and EBITDA Beat
summary: T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ:TMUS) ranks among the best long-term stocks to buy according to D. E. Shaw. On October 24, TD Cowen maintained a Buy rating on T-Mobile US, Inc. (NASDAQ:TMUS), but lowered its price target to $263 from $291. The adjustment came after T-Mobile’s third-quarter 2025 results, which included a minor EBITDA beat and […]

headline: Inside the Frantic Push to Reverse Verizon’s Decline
summary: After the board soured on Hans Vestberg’s network-first focus, his successor as CEO is planning major cost cuts.

raw.headline: Inside the Frantic Push to Reverse Verizon’s Decline
raw.summary: After the board soured on Hans Vestberg’s network-first focus, his successor as CEO is planning major cost cuts.

headline: Verizon to cut about 15,000 jobs, source says
summary: STORY: Verizon is planning to cut about 15,000 jobs at the company - its largest workforce reduction ever.That's according to a person familiar with the matter who spoke to Reuters on Thursday.The move is part of new CEO Dan Schulman’s effort to restructure the telecom giant in the face of rising competition.The source who spoke to Reuters said the layoffs will affect about 15% of Verizon's workforce... and are set to take place as soon as next week.A Verizon spokesperson declined to comment.The wireless carrier faces mounting market pressure amid concerns over a shrinking pool of new customers as older rivals - like AT&T and T-Mobile - offer cheaper plans and cable operators jump into the fray.In the third quarter, Verizon added just 44,000 monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers, lagging AT&T, while T-Mobile led with more than 1 million net subscriber additions.
